newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Sept 26.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Sept 26.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.
China's economic tsar Zhu Rongji said the selection of quality leaders was essential to win the battle against poverty.
Chinese and Japanese foreign ministers met in New York and pledged to maintain friendly ties despite recent diplomatic skirmishes.
A commentary accused some people of using human rights as a cloak for power politics and said the concept of human rights differed between cultures.
China began issuing 4.0 billion yuan worth of non-tradable bonds from September 3.
All large-scale state-owned enterprises are to start employing legal advisers.
China will build 1.2 billion square metres of residential housing by the year 2000.
